mdRecord.dcterms:title: Archaionomia: sive De priscis Anglorum legibus libri, sermone Anglico, vestustate antiquissimo, aliquot ab hinc seculis conscripti / Gulielmo Lambardo interprete .. Accessere.. Leges Henrici Primi nunc primùm editae, ex manuscripto in Fisco regis habito, unà cum glossario earum antiquo ex manuscripto codice olim S. Augustini Doroborniensis. [Paragraph] Regum qui has leges scripserunt nomenclationem, & quid præterea tum primùm ab illo, & nunc denuo à nobis accesserit, subsequens montrabit pagina
De priscis Anglorum legibus libri
Great Britain. Laws, etc
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 8 p. of leaves, 152 p., 1 leaf, 153-226 [i.e. 228], [8] p., 1 leaf including map
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Leges Inæ regis -- Leges Aluredi regis -- Fœdus Aluredi & Guthruni regum -- Leges Edovardi regis -- Fœdus Edovardi & Guthuni legum -- Leges Æthelstani regis -- Leges Edmundi regis -- Leges Edgari regis-- Canones editi sub Edgaro rege -- Leges Ethelredi regis -- Senatus consultum de monticolis Walliæ -- Leges Canuti regis -- Canones Ælfrici ad Wulfinum episcopum -- Leges Gulielmi regis -- Leges boni regis Edovardi, quas Gulielmus Bastardus postea confirmavit -- Leges Willielmi Conquestoris, et Henrici filli ejus -- Glossarium.
The laws from Ina to Canute, inclusive, and the "Canones Ælfrici" are in Anglo-Saxon and Latin, in parallel columns.
The "Leges Willielmi Conquestoris, et Henrici filli ejus (1 leaf, p. 153-216) are in Anglo-Norman and Latin, and have "Præfatio" signed: Roger Twysden.
Irregularities in paging: p. 157-158 repeated in numbering; p. 173 incorrectly numbered 171.
"This collection was originally made by Lawrance Nowell, who going abroad in 1657 [i.e. 1557?], left it to Lambarde to translate and publish"--Clarke, Bibliotheca legum.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Law, Anglo-Saxon
